intro: Ecbolium poeppigianum, commonly known as the desert morning glory, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that open in the early morning and close by midday. The plant has hairy, cylindrical stems and heart-shaped leaves that are adapted to conserve water. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Ecbolium poeppigianum is an annual herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
